meanings.definition: To represent in bodily or material form.
meanings.sent1: The statue will embody the hero's bravery.
meanings.sent2: The painting beautifully embodies the artist's emotions.
meanings.sent3: The costume party will embody a mix of creativity and fun.
meanings.sent4: Her smile embodies the warmth of a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The old house embodies the history of the town.

meanings.definition: To be a tangible or visible expression of.
meanings.sent1: His actions embody the values of honesty and integrity.
meanings.sent2: The trophy embodies the team's hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The colorful mural will embody the spirit of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The bright stars in the sky embody the dreams of many.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song embodies the feelings of love and longing.

meanings.definition: To give a concrete form to.
meanings.sent1: The architect will embody the client's vision into a building design.
meanings.sent2: The chef's dish perfectly embodies the flavors of the Mediterranean.
meanings.sent3: The dance performance will embody the essence of joy and movement.
meanings.sent4: The words in the book embody the author's imagination and creativity.
meanings.sent5: The sculpture embodies the artist's skill and passion.
